intro: Phyllanthus pronyensis, commonly known as the Proneys' spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
